title: What should a player ban entail? Victim mentality in league of legends
body:
I received a 14 day suspension on my account to today. I was told the following text is why I received this ban. To give background of myself I have been playing league since season 2 and have never gotten any type of ban. I firmly believe that staying forward thinking and focusing on your own play is how you win, and that fighting or flaming team mates only lowers your chance of winning and is a waste of your time. Yet in every single game players will flame eachother, especially if they are losing. 90% of the losing games I have had in the past 7 years of playing this game people flame each other. It will continue to be like this forever, because it is a competition and they want to win. There will always be tension in competition and that is honestly what makes it fun and worth it to play, because otherwise it feels meaningless. In the 2 games presented to me I was being flamed in both and defending myself. Both of these games are just me responding (very jokingly sarcastically) to flame being thrown at me. There is no hostile intent in anything I say. I believe the reason i got banned is because of a game that isn't shown here where I said "KYS" in all chat, and that's where I want other peoples opinions. Should saying 3 letters to someone be an auto 14 day suspension of perma ban?

There is always going to be negativity thrown at you in life, especially on the internet.  There is toxicity in the majority of league of legends games, that is a fact. Should there be governance to keep toxicity down so it doesn't get out of control? absolutely. But i believe the current direction creates victims instead of arming players against the inevitable. There is a responsibility to players that are being flamed, just the same as there is to players that WANT to flame. They need to mute them and continue to think forward and constructive, and should be encouraged to do so. I shouldn't type "KYS" in chat to someone, but I shouldn't get an auto 14 day ban for it. The player that reported me is not a victim, and I am not an offender. Because everyone who is a victim in this game is also an offender. It is the ones that flame more often that deserve an automatic ban. If players flame and ruin the game every time they play please ban them automatically. I don't ever talk negatively in chat and i said KYS one time to someone flaming me and get a 14 day ban for it. That isn't right. I don't want the person to kill himself obviously, I want him to realize I'm not a punching bag and that I will defend myself. People are not going to end their lives because someone says "KYS" to them over a video game in response to banter. Honestly if it is going to be an autoban then it needs to be more clear and there needs to be a warning instead of 14 day suspension as the first offense.  

The point in all of this is that I believe there needs to be more attention raised about how players should react to toxicity and flame. It is inevitable that it will happen and instead of it being encouraged to be a victim (which breeds arguing and more toxicity), it should be encouraged to NOT react to it and mute the player instead. It is not a personal attack on people when you tell them they suck at a video game. The person just doesn't know how to win so the only action they know how to take is flaming their team mate. It is never a personal issue and therefore shouldn't be taken personally.  What are other peoples thoughts? Should saying KYS ban you from playing for 14 days and potentially perma ban you? Also please unban me so I can get my gold border ^.^

You go on about "victim mentality" criticizing a person's choice to report someone for poor behavior, but then you have this in your post game;

>Overcastx: pls report brand for verbal abuse
Overcastx: he really hurt my feelings

After all-caps insulting in-game.

I consider this ban deserved, but this bit of hypocrisy from this post was just icing on the cake.

“I firmly believe that staying forward thinking and focusing on your own play is how you win”

I can’t reconcile this sentiment with these chat logs.

It seems most of you are missing the point of the post. What I said in the games is irrelevant to the post aside from "KYS". Everything I said in the 2 games is simply response to being hard flamed and not serious or hostile at all.
Which is understandable considering it is taken out of context but please take my word for it that it is light hearted banter. Using the word idiot is not holding a knife to someone's throat

I don't take your word for it. Obviously you insulted and pissed people off, otherwise they wouldn't have reported you. Unless you think you have an objectively accurate understanding of everybody's sense of humor? These are strangers, not your school buddies. 

And telling somebody to kill themselves over a video game is fucking disgusting.

Why must everything be so PC though? Why do you need an objective understanding of someone to joke with them on an internet video game? Telling someone to KYS is not meant to be taken literally in my eyes, more like a "fuck off". It is not a good thing to hear if you are in a bad mood, I agree.  It has a very high success rate of someone shutting up that is flaming you and that is why I used it.
For somebody who can't possibly know you or interpret your tone, since they're a stranger on the other side of the internet, the only sane interpretation of your words is literal.

It's not about politically correct. It's about being a decent human being, accepting that words have weight, and that actions have consequences.

If you're incapable of treating people decently, then there's a simple fix: Remove the enter key from your keyboard while playing LoL. Then you don't have to worry about it. You can rage all you like verbally and they'll never know, and you won't get banned.

Or you could just treat people decently... 

Also, think for a second... say someone *IS* suicidally depressed and uses LoL as their coping mechanism. Gaming is an escape for a lot of people who have been emotionally abused while they deal with the problems. Now, this person comes here and looks to have some fun to distract themselves so they can cope with the state of things temporarily... and are confronted with someone like you telling them to kill themselves. Reinforcing the thoughts they've been resisting, turning their sanctuary into a reminder. What if you DO drive someone to that, someone who might otherwise have lasted long enough to find the solution to their problems, or even to come to terms with it and seek help... is the risk worth it? And, do you really want to have that be your fault?

I, personally, don't think so. Even if it's not likely. I'd rather we NOT support that type of behaviour, so as to reduce the risk of causing people genuine harm through our words.

It's not about being pc. Some people just don't want to listen to shittalk like this, being an aggressor or a response which fuels the argumentation doesn't matter.
There is a BIG difference between telling sm1 to shut up and telling sm1 to end their life, accept it.
And kys with a very high successrate of shutting people up? Are you serious?

> -where I said "KYS" in all chat, and that's where I want other peoples opinions. Should saying 3 letters to someone be an auto 14 day suspension of perma ban?

 Made my conclusion after this point. It isn't just "3 letters". 

It may be that to you, but you need to respect the fact that it is much more to others. Part of being an adult is respecting other peoples opinions and being mindful of the things you say. 

Hearing 'KYS' over and over on a day to day basis amongst other struggles people may have going on in their lives can compound itself and lead to negative things or even suicide. It's happened before on/because of League.

I know I've struggled a bunch after having a shitty work day, coming home to a shitty situation with my SO, wanting to hop on League and relax but instead I get 6-9 people that just flame constantly or tell me to kill myself. It's just exhausting. 

 Start to show some respect or risk the permaban. Good luck.

Thank you for the actual feedback. I would never take that personally on the internet, but it is obvious now that some people do, and maybe a 14 day ban instantly is necessary in a community like this

Yeah, no sweat dude. I know that everyone thinks differently, and honestly it's cool if you disagree with what I said. If you don't think people should be offended by that stuff that's fine, it doesn't make you a bad person. It just all comes down to respecting other people and remembering that there's a person behind every computer screen.

I think it is easy to think from the perspective of being in a bad mood if you are frequently in a bad mood yourself. Which evidently, the majority of league players are.  Although I have no bad intentions in what I say, I can see that I need to expect that it is taken as hostility. When my friends and I play games or sports we shit talk each other the whole time and it makes it more fun. I don't want to make anyone's rough life even more rough at all. 

I do think the agenda should preach more about how to deal with "toxic" players instead of "ban the 'toxic' guy" because literally everyone gets frustrated and types negatively at times. Not only would it be good for the game, but it would be good for these players quality of life.

How are you a being victimized when you're tormenting someone in your chat?
You find yourself undeserving of the ban and playing victim while you're part of the problem this community is fighting. 

It doesn't matter how long you've played this, how much money you've put into this game, or who you are.
It doesn't give you the rights to be toxic in the game while insulting, criticizing someone's choice in this game.

Mute and report the player if you want to fight toxicity.
Don't become it by retaliating. Retaliating is no better than initiating it.
